--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, EmprzAnastazia@a... wrote:
> In a message dated 1/30/03 8:02:25 AM Central Standard Time, 
> cardhead649@y... writes:
> 
> 
> > "Let me see ..." Jackie slides out from under the control 
> > panel.  "Rebuilding a robot form ..." he accesses his databanks, 
> > trying to match the name Maxima into his history files.  "Seeker, 
> > right?"
> 
> "Something like that." nothing like Starscream, but close.
> 
> > 
> > He stands up and looks her over.  "We've got three options.  If I 
> > installed a flight mode and associated components on your current 
> > body, it would take a few hours.  On the other hand, building a 
> > transformer shell from scratch could take days - but it's a lot 
more 
> > authentic.  Or we could combine the two, giving you a temporary 
> > upgrade to tide you over until your new body is ready.  Either 
way, 
> > you're putting a lot of trust in me."
> 
> "Let's do it. I'm tired of this pathetic form." She didn't say that 
it was 
> Alpha Trion within Vector Sigma that gave her the form & revived 
her. As to 
> WHY he revived her, she did not know. 
> 
> "Just construct my original form & do what upgrades you can on this 
one. IF 
> that is possible." 
> 
> She smirked. "Besides, if you are anything like the Autobot 
Wheeljack I 
> 'knew' of, then such a task is nothing."

"Eh, it's no problem."  Wheeljack-X pops out a scanning tool and 
begins measuring her body to see what he has to work with.  "I like 
doing this sort of thing."  After a few moments of examination and 
planning, he projects a scaled-down wireframe image of her body in 
the air, and next to it a similar image of the vehicle mode that 
would best match such a body type.  Superimposing the two, he gets a 
rough blueprint to work from.  "I'm gonna have to take you offline 
for a while, while I install the upgrade."
